New Records: John Collins scored 28 points and made a game-winning dunk with 6.4 seconds remaining to lift the Utah Jazz to a 115-113 win over the Dallas Mavericks
Key Match Events: Jordan Clarkson added 20 points for the Jazz, and his bullet pass set up Collins’ game-winner.
Luka Doncic led all scorers with 37 points to go with nine assists and seven rebounds, but Dallas came up painfully short again.
Collins gave the Jazz a 113-110 lead with 36.7 seconds remaining after pulling Clarkson’s missed shot mid-air and softly dunking it.
Klay Thompson then tied the game with one of his five 3-pointers.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mavericks played without Kyrie Irving (strained right shoulder)
Post-Match Reflections: Utah picked up its first home win in six games this season. The Jazz were off to their worst home start since the franchise’s inaugural 1974-75 season in New Orleans.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dallas dropped its fourth consecutive game, with the losses coming by a combined eight points.
Utah has won three of five after starting the season 0-6.
Both teams shot 50.6 percent from the field (43 of 85). Utah hit one more 3-pointer than Dallas (13 to 12) and outrebounded the visitors 40-30.
Others: Collins hit 10 of 20 shots, grabbed nine rebounds, dished out three assists and had two steals. He scored 13 points in the third quarter when Utah outscored Dallas 38-21 en route to a 14-point lead.
Marshall finished with 19 points, Quentin Grimes contributed 15 and Daniel Gafford netted 10 for Dallas.
